ngiemboon: Ndùŋmvfò lyɛ̌ʼ na ngàba láʼ gÿo ńgwɔ́, panzwě ŋwɛ́ mʉ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mbaʼámbaʼ, ńdɔgɔ laméndɔ̀ɔn gie pɔ́ la nyɛte ńgʉa né jʉʼʉ lesyè.
en: On   the first day of the week,  # 24:1 Ac 20:7; 1Co 16:2 very early in the morning, they  # 24:1 Other mss add and other women with them came to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà mé ka fó ncwò lesyè, ńtsó máamáa tóon gẅie à kaa wó.
en: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsoló, ńké te pfó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô gyá.
en: They went in but did not find the body   of the Lord Jesus.  # 24:3 Lk 7:13; Ac 1:21

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tyé ńdíe jʉʼ, é ne ńkʉʼʉ wɔ́b, ńgwaa gyá, epʉ̀a mépʉ́a kẅɛ, ḿmaʼ menzsǒ, é fɔ́g tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: While they were perplexed about this, suddenly two men stood by them in dazzling   clothes.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cÿɔʼ tà ńcʉ́ʼ ńdíe pɔ́ ssé, tá pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi tóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ mepfó ssé, éfaʼa nyìŋ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ mélàʼakɔ́?
en: So the women were terrified and bowed down to the ground.

ngiemboon: À cʉʼʉ́ jʉʼɔɔn wɔ́, à zimé na legwé. Pi zɔɔn ńkímte nò gie à la ne ńgɔɔn mbwó pi fʉ̀ʼ gie pi lâ pɔ̌ la nyé ńgwɔ́ Ngalílîa.
en: “He is not here, but he has risen!   Remember how he spoke to you when he was still in Galilee,  # 24:6 Mt 17:22–23; Mk 9:30–31; Lk 9:22,44

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn ngie: “Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé sẅiŋe Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwó pʉ̀a tepòŋ, pɔ́ kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ, à zíme na legwé na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ tá.”»
en: saying, ‘It is necessary that the Son of Man be betrayed    into the hands of sinful men, be crucified, and rise   # 24:7 Mt 17:9,23; Mk 8:31; 9:31; 10:34; Lk 18:33; 24:46 on the third day’? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńkímte ngie, ée menò mie Yěsô la zɔɔn éshwóŋo wɔ́b,
en: And they remembered his words.

ngiemboon: éfó jʉʼó, ńgʉa ḿbú ḿbíte menò ntsèm mie é cʉ̌a, éshwóŋ megàŋakwò pé ntsɔ̀b wémmɔʼɔ́ né legém, mbɔɔ mbwó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a na nùɔ yɔ́b.
en: Returning from the tomb, they reported all these things to the Eleven   and to all the rest.

ngiemboon: Panzwě ŋwɛ́ lâ Malîɛ we Magndala, ńgÿo Jÿâane, mbɔɔ Malîɛ má pà Jÿâg, pâ petsɔ́ panzwě. Pɔ́ píte menò ŋwɛ́ éshwóŋ megàŋntúm Yěsô.
en: Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James,   and the other women with them were telling the apostles  # 24:10 Lk 6:13 these things.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ njÿòon la, pɔ́ té zẅíŋ.
en: But these words seemed like nonsense to them, and they did not believe   the women.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Piɛ lu ssé, ńkÿote tà ńkúu jʉʼʉ lesyè, ńŋwéʼe ssé, ńgyá pɔ́ ndàʼ shúm nzsǒ sie mé la lɔg ńzémte pfó Yěsô, ńgwaa piŋ, á gíŋe ńkʉʼʉ yé, à te ne ńzsé mmó gie á cʉ̌a wɔ́.
en: Peter,   however, got up and ran to the tomb. When he stooped to look in, he saw only the linen cloths.  # 24:12 Other mss add lying there,# 24:12 Lk 23:53 So he went away, amazed  # 24:12 Lk 1:21,63; 2:18,33; 4:22; Ac 2:7; 3:12 at what had happened.

ngiemboon: Á la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lyɛʼó, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a, á na nùɔ Yěsô lu ssé Yelúzálèm, ńne ńgee né tsɔ́ láʼ gie mé tóŋo lê Emagẅísè. Legʉa tà ńkúu wó, á gwɔ́ mmó mekílò ntsɔ̀b wémmɔʼɔ́ né legém.
en: Now   that same day two of them were on their way to a village called Emmaus, which was about seven miles  # 24:13 Lit about sixty stadia; one stadion = 600 feet,# 24:13 Rv 21:16 from Jerusalem.  # 24:13 Mt 23:37; Ac 8:1

ngiemboon: Ńgiŋe éshwóŋe na menò ntsèm mie é ka pǔ ńcʉa.
en: Together they were discussing everything that had taken place.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ la ne shwóŋe, ńne ńzoŋo la, Yěsô yé máŋwɛ́ kẅɛ́te wɔ́b mánzsè, pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgiŋe.
en: And while they were discussing and arguing, Jesus himself came near and began to walk along with them.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, atsɔ́ mmó táte wɔ́b, pɔ́ té yé liŋ.
en: But they   were prevented from recognizing him.  # 24:16 Lk 9:45; 18:34; Jn 20:14–15; 21:4

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi sěen ńgiŋe ńzoŋo pɔ́ kɔ́ pɛ́ʼɛ̀?» Pɔ́ júʼ ńtyé, ḿmaʼ mezìŋe.
en: Then he asked them, “What is this dispute that you’re having    with each other as you are walking? ” And they stopped walking and looked discouraged.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tàʼ nyìŋ na pɔ́b gẅie lezíŋ sé laa lê Keleyopásè zɛ́te yé ngie: «Mânyìŋ ntsèm Yelúzálèm zsě mmó gie á ka gÿo Yelúzálèm na melyɛ̌ʼ mɔɔn, tà é cʉ́ʼ ndàʼ gú lá?»
en: The one named Cleopas answered him, “Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things that happened there in these days? ”

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Akɔ́ ka gÿo?» Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: «Peg kɔʼɔ́ ńne ḿmɔɔn pɔ́ menò mie é ka gÿo Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzalɛd. À kaa kwàʼ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé welÿò, á na mefàʼ mé, mbɔɔ na shwóŋè yé á mvfò Ssé mbɔɔ mvfò pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: “What things? ” he asked them.

ngiemboon: Páʼ metándá panuŋepwɔʼ pâ pasáʼa láʼ pég ka sẅéen yé ńnáa mbwó Pilato ngie mé gʉa ńŋaga yé, ńzẅé yé. Mé ka leen ńké ńkime yé na tÿǒnkǐ.
en: and how our chief priests and leaders   handed him over to be sentenced to death,  # 24:20 Lk 9:44; 18:32; Ac 3:13; 13:27–28 and they crucified him.  # 24:20 Lk 23:21,25; Ac 5:30

ngiemboon: Mbà peg ka ne ńkwaŋa ngie yé zɔ ge láʼ záʼ nkÿo ngɔ́ʼ, á lóŋ Ésàlayɛ à tsẅɛ́. Mɔɔn menò ka gÿo, ée lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sétá.
en: But we were hoping that he was the one who was about to redeem   Israel. Besides all this, it’s the third day  # 24:21 Lk 9:22; 13:32; 18:33 since these things happened.

ngiemboon: É té ndàʼ púʼu wɔ́, etsɔ́ panzwě tsetsɛ̀ɛ peg, é ně ńkʉʼʉ wég. Pɔ́ ně ḿmʉ́ melémnjÿó lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, ńgʉa jʉʼʉ lesyè,
en: Moreover, some women from our group astounded us. They arrived early at the tomb,

ngiemboon: pɔ́ té pfó yé gyá, ḿbiŋ nzèm éshwóŋo wég ngie pɔ́ kǔu wó, mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé kẅɛɛ mvfò pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀!
en: and when they didn’t find his body, they came and reported that they had seen a vision of angels who said he was alive.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pég ně ńjúʼ púʼu, ńdu ssé, ńgíŋ ńgʉa yɔ́b jʉʼʉ lesyè, ńgyá á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ panzwě ně shwóŋo wɔ́b púʼu, tá pɔ́ ké te Yěsô gyá.»
en: Some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gwě gígyé. Pi te ne ńdwo ńzẅíŋe menò ntsèm mie pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋweʼe wɔ́.
en: He said to them, “How foolish you are, and how slow    to believe all that the prophets have spoken!   # 24:25 Lk 16:31; 18:31; Ac 26:27; 2Pt 1:21

ngiemboon: Pi kaa zsé ngie, á ka ne ńzɛ́te ngie Nzàʼnkÿo vɔg ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ legúʼ we wɔ́ ka?»
en: Wasn’t it necessary for the Messiah to suffer    these things and enter into his glory? ”   # 24:26 Lk 9:26,32; 21:27; 22:69; Ac 2:33; 7:55; 22:11

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńzye lékyagte menò ntsèm mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ńne ńdíe yé, éshwóŋo wɔ́b, ńzye na meŋwàʼne Mǒonsê, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ me pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Then beginning with Moses   and all the Prophets,  # 24:27 2Sm 7:12–16; Is 7:14; 9:6; 52:13–53:12; Jr 23:5–6; Dn 7:13–14; Mc 5:2; Zch 9:9; 12:10 he interpreted for them the things concerning himself in all the Scriptures.  # 24:27 Lk 16:16

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ gʉa tà ne ńkúu láʼ gie pɔ́ mépʉ́a lɔ́ɔn ńgee wó. Pɔ́ gyá á faʼa pɔ́ páʼ à giŋé ńge giŋ tà ngʉ̀a sag.
en: They came near the village where they were going, and he gave the impression that he was going farther.

ngiemboon: Tá pɔ́ kúʼte yé, ngie pâ pɔ̌ pú ńdáʼ, mélàʼmie nzèm cʉʼʉ́ síŋe sǐŋ, zàʼ cʉ̌a. Á zẅíŋ pâ pɔ̌ kúu ndá gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgee né wó.
en: But they urged him, “Stay with us, because it’s almost evening, and now the day is almost over.” So he went in to stay with them.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ léjÿó shúm gÿo ńkuʼ, pɔ́ néŋe ssé, á pí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ḿbwɔ́ʼte ńná né pɔ́b.
en: It was as he reclined at the table with them that he took the bread, blessed and broke   it, and gave it to them.

ngiemboon: Tá menÿɔ́g mɔ́b leen ńké ńkyɛ́ʼɛ pɔ́ liŋe yé, á gwóon ḿbyé.
en: Then their eyes were opened,   and they recognized him, but he disappeared from their sight.  # 24:31 Jn 20:19,26

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ sele ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Yɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie á kɔʼɔ́ ńgÿo, tá shwóŋè yé kúte wɔ́gɔ̀ fʉ̀ʼ gie pege kɔʼɔ́ ńgwɔ́ mánzsè, á ne ńkyagte nò Ssé éshwóŋo wɔ́gɔ̀ la!»
en: They said to each other, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us while he was talking with us on the road and explaining the Scriptures   to us? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lu ssé pɔ́ fʉʼó, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńgíŋ ḿbiŋe Yelúzálèm, ńkẅɛ́te megàŋakwò Yěsô ntsɔ̀b wémmɔʼɔ́ né legém, mbà pâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Yěsô cuʼté.
en: That very hour they got up and returned to Jerusalem. They found the Eleven   and those with them gathered together,

ngiemboon: Ńkẅɛ́te wɔ́b púʼu, pɔ́ shwóŋo wɔ́b ngie: «Áa nénʉ́ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zimé na legwé, Símò ně ńgyá yé.»
en: who said, “The Lord has truly been raised and has appeared to Simon! ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋ ḿbíte yɔ́b mmó gie pɔ́ ně ńtóo mánzsè ńgyá, ngie pɔ́ ně ńgwaa liŋe yé, mbà à pǐ mbelég tà ne ńgaba.
en: Then they began to describe what had happened on the road and how he was made known to them in the breaking of the bread.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nyé shwóŋo shwoŋó, ńgwaa gyá, Yěsô kẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtsyɛʼte wɔ́b ngie: «Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ né pi!»
en: As   they were saying these things, he himself stood in their midst. He said to them, “Peace   # 24:36 Lk 2:14; 7:50; 8:48; 10:5; 19:38; Ac 10:36 to you! ”

ngiemboon: Aléme yɔ́b tsɔ́ʼɔ. Pɔ́ cÿɔʼ, ńzɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa pɔ́ ngie áa gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ.
en: But they were startled and terrified   and thought they were seeing a ghost.  # 24:37 Mt 14:26

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Aléme gí séen ńtsɔ́ʼɔ tsɔʼɔ́ mélàʼakɔ́? Pi mʉʼte mʉʼté mélàʼakɔ́?
en: “Why are you troubled? ”    he asked them. “And why do doubts arise in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi líe mbwó mɔ́ɔn né mekwò mɔ́ɔn tá ńgyá, aa kwàʼ mèŋ. Pi mwoonte wɔ́ɔn tá ńjúʼ, gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ té mbab nnɛ́ gẅiin, ńké te mekẅǐ gẅiin, pi ké ńgyá páʼ, m biŋ ńgẅiin mbab nnɛ́ né mekẅǐ.»
en: Look at my hands and my feet, that it is I myself!    Touch me and see,   # 24:39 Mt 28:9; Ac 2:31; 17:18,31–32; 23:6–10; 24:15,21 because a ghost does not have flesh and bones as you can see I have.”

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gɔɔn ńne nyɛɛ wɔ́b mbwó mé lâ mekwò mé.
en: Having said this, he showed them his hands and feet.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkága tɛʼ táʼ, á nyé ńkʉʼʉ wɔ́b kʉʼʉ, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ka áa nò wɔ́ɔ? Yěsô gyá páʼ pɔ́ nyé ḿmʉ́ʼte mʉʼté, ńdeen ńké ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi gẅiin mmó mpfɛ̌ jʉʼɔɔn?»
en: But while they still were amazed and in disbelief because of their joy, he asked them, “Do you have anything here to eat? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ faʼa kème ssó ye ntuɔ ńná né yé.
en: So they gave him a piece of a broiled fish,

ngiemboon: Á kẅé, ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b ḿpfɛ́.
en: and he took it and ate in their presence.

ngiemboon: À la pfɛ́ tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gyá mmó gie n kɔ̌ɔn shwóŋo gẅí, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pege ka nyé ńzɔ́gɔ. N kɔ̌ɔn shwóŋo gẅí ngie á ne ńzɛ́te ngie yɛ̌ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ gie mé la ŋweʼe ńtí wɔ́ɔn, à pumte. Menò ŋwɛ́ ntsèm ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne Mǒonsê, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ye pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé lâ ye Mezɔ̀bɔntse.»
en: He told them, “These are my words    that I spoke to you while I was still with you #— #that everything written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets,   # 24:44 Ac 13:15; 28:23 and the Psalms   # 24:44 Ps 2:6–9; 16:10; 22:1–18; 34:20; 41:9; 69:1–9,20–21,26; 110:1–7; 118:22–26 must be fulfilled.”

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńtsɔ́ʼ legye sɔ́b, ńgÿo pɔ́ júʼ menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé.
en: Then he opened their minds   to understand  # 24:45 Lk 9:45; 18:34 the Scriptures.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn ngie: «Áa tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ńgwɔ́ ngie Nzàʼnkÿo gẅiin léláʼ ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ, ńkwé, tá Ssé piŋ ńzíme yé na legwé á na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ tá.
en: He also said to them, “This is what is written:    The Messiah will suffer and rise from the dead the third day,   # 24:46 Ps 16:10; Lk 9:22,44; 17:25; 18:32; Ac 8:26–40; 1Co 15:3–4

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé láʼ ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, éshwóŋo nò Ssé mbwó láʼa láʼ ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kúbe mà we, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mé. Púʼu, é ké zye pɔ́ Yelúzálèm.
en: and repentance for    forgiveness of sins   # 24:47 Hs 14:2; Lk 3:3; Ac 2:38; 5:31; 8:22 will be proclaimed in his name to all the nations,   # 24:47 Gn 12:3; Ps 22:27; Is 2:2; 49:6; Hs 2:23; Mal 1:11; Mt 28:19–20; Mk 16:15 beginning at Jerusalem.   # 24:47–49 Ac 1:4–8

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ̂ zɔ ké ńgwɔ́ pajÿòngyá, á lélɔg menò ŋwɛ́ ésaa láʼ.
en: You are witnesses    of these things.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie n ge gÿo túmo mmó gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn la kaʼa lénáa mbwó pi. Pi ké ńzẅíʼte pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ tà ńkúu fʉ̀ʼ gie ngʉ̀ʼ Ssé é ge fó tÿǒ lepwó é sẅɛ́ʼ kúu na pi.»
en: And look, I am sending you    what my Father promised.   # 24:49 Is 32:15; Jl 2:28–32; Jn 14:26; Ac 2:16–21; Eph 1:13 As for you, stay in the city   # 24:49 Other mss add of Jerusalem until you are empowered   # 24:49 Lit clothed with power,# 24:49 Ac 4:33; Rm 15:13 from on high.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn púʼu, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ lékúu Mbetani, ńkwéʼe mbwó mé ńnáa tÿǒ, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na pɔ́b.
en: Then he led them out to the vicinity of Bethany,   and lifting up his hands  # 24:50 Lv 9:22; 1Tm 2:8 he blessed them.

ngiemboon: Ńne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè na pɔ́b púʼu, ńne ńkwɔ́ʼɔ ńgee né tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And while he was blessing them, he left them and was carried up into heaven.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé, tà á kuʼ, pɔ́ lɔgɔ lekág ḿbiŋ nzèm né Yelúzálèm.
en: After worshiping him,   they returned to Jerusalem with great joy.  # 24:52 Lk 2:10

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńké ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńguʼte Ssé.
en: And they were continually in the temple praising God.  ,# 24:53 Ac 2:46; 3:1; 5:42
